trans-unit.source: Describes the security and privacy features that protect your StorSimple service, device, and data on premises and in the cloud.

trans-unit.source: StorSimple security and data protection
trans-unit.target: StorSimple security and data protection

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: Security is a major concern for anyone who is adopting a new technology, especially when the technology is used with confidential or proprietary data.
trans-unit.target: Security is a major concern for anyone who is adopting a new technology, especially when the technology is used with confidential or proprietary data.

trans-unit.source: As you evaluate different technologies, you must consider increased risks and costs for data protection.
trans-unit.target: As you evaluate different technologies, you must consider increased risks and costs for data protection.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Azure StorSimple provides both a security and privacy solution for data protection, helping to ensure:
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Azure StorSimple provides both a security and privacy solution for data protection, helping to ensure:

trans-unit.source: **Confidentiality** – Only authorized entities can view your data.
trans-unit.target: **Confidentiality** – Only authorized entities can view your data.

trans-unit.source: **Integrity** – Only authorized entities can modify or delete your data.
trans-unit.target: **Integrity** – Only authorized entities can modify or delete your data.

trans-unit.source: The Microsoft Azure StorSimple solution consists of four main components that interact with each other:
trans-unit.target: The Microsoft Azure StorSimple solution consists of four main components that interact with each other:

trans-unit.source: **StorSimple Manager service hosted in Microsoft Azure** – The management service that you use to configure and provision the StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: **StorSimple Manager service hosted in Microsoft Azure** – The management service that you use to configure and provision the StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: **StorSimple device** – A physical device installed in your datacenter.
trans-unit.target: **StorSimple device** – A physical device installed in your datacenter.

trans-unit.source: All hosts and clients that generate data connect to the StorSimple device, and the device manages the data and moves it to the Azure cloud as appropriate.
trans-unit.target: All hosts and clients that generate data connect to the StorSimple device, and the device manages the data and moves it to the Azure cloud as appropriate.

trans-unit.source: **Clients/hosts connected to the device** – The clients in your infrastructure that connect to the StorSimple device and generate data that needs to be protected.
trans-unit.target: **Clients/hosts connected to the device** – The clients in your infrastructure that connect to the StorSimple device and generate data that needs to be protected.

trans-unit.source: **Cloud storage** – The location in the Azure cloud where data is stored.
trans-unit.target: **Cloud storage** – The location in the Azure cloud where data is stored.

trans-unit.source: The following sections describe the StorSimple security features that help protect each of these components and the data stored on them.
trans-unit.target: The following sections describe the StorSimple security features that help protect each of these components and the data stored on them.

trans-unit.source: StorSimple Manager service protection
trans-unit.target: StorSimple Manager service protection

trans-unit.source: The StorSimple Manager service is a management service hosted in Microsoft Azure and used to manage all StorSimple devices that your organization has procured.
trans-unit.target: The StorSimple Manager service is a management service hosted in Microsoft Azure and used to manage all StorSimple devices that your organization has procured.

trans-unit.source: You can access the StorSimple Manager service by using your organizational credentials to log on to the Azure Management Portal through a web browser.
trans-unit.target: You can access the StorSimple Manager service by using your organizational credentials to log on to the Azure Management Portal through a web browser.

trans-unit.source: Access to the StorSimple Manager service requires that your organization have an Azure subscription that includes StorSimple.
trans-unit.target: Access to the StorSimple Manager service requires that your organization have an Azure subscription that includes StorSimple.

trans-unit.source: Your subscription governs the features that you can access in the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: Your subscription governs the features that you can access in the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: If your organization does not have an Azure subscription and you want to learn more about them, see [Sign up for Azure as an organization](../sign-up-organization.md).
trans-unit.target: If your organization does not have an Azure subscription and you want to learn more about them, see [Sign up for Azure as an organization](../sign-up-organization.md).

trans-unit.source: Because the StorSimple Manager service is hosted in Azure, it is protected by the Azure security features.
trans-unit.target: Because the StorSimple Manager service is hosted in Azure, it is protected by the Azure security features.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the security features provided by Microsoft Azure, go to the [Microsoft Azure Trust Center](http://azure.microsoft.com/support/trust-center/security/).
trans-unit.target: For more information about the security features provided by Microsoft Azure, go to the [Microsoft Azure Trust Center](http://azure.microsoft.com/support/trust-center/security/).

trans-unit.source: StorSimple device protection
trans-unit.target: StorSimple device protection

trans-unit.source: The StorSimple device is an on-premises hybrid storage device that contains solid state drives (SSDs) and hard disk drives (HDDs), together with redundant controllers and automatic failover capabilities.
trans-unit.target: The StorSimple device is an on-premises hybrid storage device that contains solid state drives (SSDs) and hard disk drives (HDDs), together with redundant controllers and automatic failover capabilities.

trans-unit.source: The controllers manage storage tiering, placing currently used (or hot) data on local storage (in the StorSimple device or on-premises servers), while moving less frequently used data to the cloud.
trans-unit.target: The controllers manage storage tiering, placing currently used (or hot) data on local storage (in the StorSimple device or on-premises servers), while moving less frequently used data to the cloud.

trans-unit.source: Control access to StorSimple via device registration
trans-unit.target: Control access to StorSimple via device registration

trans-unit.source: Only authorized StorSimple devices are allowed to join the StorSimple Manager service that you created in your Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: Only authorized StorSimple devices are allowed to join the StorSimple Manager service that you created in your Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: To authorize a device, you must register it with the StorSimple Manager service by providing the service registration key.
trans-unit.target: To authorize a device, you must register it with the StorSimple Manager service by providing the service registration key.

trans-unit.source: The service registration key is a 128-bit random key generated in the portal.
trans-unit.target: The service registration key is a 128-bit random key generated in the portal.

trans-unit.source: To learn how get a service registration key, go to [Step 2: Get the service registration key](storsimple-deployment-walkthrough.md#step-2-get-the-service-registration-key).
trans-unit.target: To learn how get a service registration key, go to [Step 2: Get the service registration key](storsimple-deployment-walkthrough.md#step-2-get-the-service-registration-key).

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The service registration key is a long key that contains 100+ characters.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The service registration key is a long key that contains 100+ characters.

trans-unit.source: We recommend that you copy the key and save it in a text file in a secure location so that you can use it to authorize additional devices as necessary.
trans-unit.target: We recommend that you copy the key and save it in a text file in a secure location so that you can use it to authorize additional devices as necessary.

trans-unit.source: If the service registration key is lost after you register your first device, you can generate a new key from the StorSimple Manager service.
trans-unit.target: If the service registration key is lost after you register your first device, you can generate a new key from the StorSimple Manager service.

trans-unit.source: This will not affect the operation of existing devices.
trans-unit.target: This will not affect the operation of existing devices.

trans-unit.source: After a device is registered, it uses tokens to communicate with Microsoft Azure.
trans-unit.target: After a device is registered, it uses tokens to communicate with Microsoft Azure.

trans-unit.source: The service registration key is not used after device registration.
trans-unit.target: The service registration key is not used after device registration.

trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShell for StorSimple and StorSimple device administrator passwords
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShell for StorSimple and StorSimple device administrator passwords

trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShell for StorSimple is a command-line interface that you can use to manage the StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShell for StorSimple is a command-line interface that you can use to manage the StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShell for StorSimple has features that allow you to register your device, configure the network interface on your device, install certain types of updates, troubleshoot your device by accessing the support session, and change the device state.
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShell for StorSimple has features that allow you to register your device, configure the network interface on your device, install certain types of updates, troubleshoot your device by accessing the support session, and change the device state.

trans-unit.source: You can access Windows PowerShell for StorSimple by connecting to the serial console or by using Windows PowerShell remoting.
trans-unit.target: You can access Windows PowerShell for StorSimple by connecting to the serial console or by using Windows PowerShell remoting.

trans-unit.source: PowerShell remoting can be done over HTTPS or HTTP.
trans-unit.target: PowerShell remoting can be done over HTTPS or HTTP.

trans-unit.source: If remote management over HTTPS is enabled, you will need to download the remote management certificate from the device and install it on the remote client.
trans-unit.target: If remote management over HTTPS is enabled, you will need to download the remote management certificate from the device and install it on the remote client.

trans-unit.source: Remote management is turned off by default.
trans-unit.target: Remote management is turned off by default.

trans-unit.source: You can use the StorSimple Manager service to enable it.
trans-unit.target: You can use the StorSimple Manager service to enable it.

trans-unit.source: As a security best practice, remote access should be enabled only during the time period that it is actually needed.
trans-unit.target: As a security best practice, remote access should be enabled only during the time period that it is actually needed.

trans-unit.source: If you change the password, be sure to notify all remote access users so that they do not experience an unexpected connectivity loss.
trans-unit.target: If you change the password, be sure to notify all remote access users so that they do not experience an unexpected connectivity loss.

trans-unit.source: The StorSimple Manager service cannot retrieve existing passwords: it can only reset them.
trans-unit.target: The StorSimple Manager service cannot retrieve existing passwords: it can only reset them.

trans-unit.source: We recommend that you store all passwords in a secure place so that you do not have to reset a password if it is forgotten.
trans-unit.target: We recommend that you store all passwords in a secure place so that you do not have to reset a password if it is forgotten.

trans-unit.source: If you do need to reset a password, be sure to notify all users before you reset it.
trans-unit.target: If you do need to reset a password, be sure to notify all users before you reset it.

trans-unit.source: You can access the Windows PowerShell interface by using a serial connection to the device.
trans-unit.target: You can access the Windows PowerShell interface by using a serial connection to the device.

trans-unit.source: You can also access it remotely by using either HTTP or HTTPS, which provide additional security.
trans-unit.target: You can also access it remotely by using either HTTP or HTTPS, which provide additional security.

trans-unit.source: HTTPS provides a higher level of security than either a serial or HTTP connection.
trans-unit.target: HTTPS provides a higher level of security than either a serial or HTTP connection.

trans-unit.source: However, to use HTTPS, you must first install a certificate on the client computer that will access the device.
trans-unit.target: However, to use HTTPS, you must first install a certificate on the client computer that will access the device.

trans-unit.source: You can download the remote access certificate from the device configuration page in the StorSimple Manager service.
trans-unit.target: You can download the remote access certificate from the device configuration page in the StorSimple Manager service.

trans-unit.source: If the certificate for remote access is lost, you must download a new certificate and propagate it to all clients that are authorized to use remote management.
trans-unit.target: If the certificate for remote access is lost, you must download a new certificate and propagate it to all clients that are authorized to use remote management.

trans-unit.source: After you use Windows PowerShell for StorSimple to connect to the device, you will need to provide the device administrator password to log on to the device.
trans-unit.target: After you use Windows PowerShell for StorSimple to connect to the device, you will need to provide the device administrator password to log on to the device.

trans-unit.source: Challenge Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP) initiator and target passwords
trans-unit.target: Challenge Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP) initiator and target passwords

trans-unit.source: CHAP is an authentication scheme used by the StorSimple device to validate the identity of remote clients.
trans-unit.target: CHAP is an authentication scheme used by the StorSimple device to validate the identity of remote clients.

trans-unit.source: The verification is based on a shared password.
trans-unit.target: The verification is based on a shared password.

trans-unit.source: CHAP can be one-way (unidirectional) or mutual (bidirectional).
trans-unit.target: CHAP can be one-way (unidirectional) or mutual (bidirectional).

trans-unit.source: With one-way CHAP, the target (the StorSimple device) authenticates an initiator (host).
trans-unit.target: With one-way CHAP, the target (the StorSimple device) authenticates an initiator (host).

trans-unit.source: Mutual CHAP requires that the target authenticate the initiator and then the initiator authenticate the target.
trans-unit.target: Mutual CHAP requires that the target authenticate the initiator and then the initiator authenticate the target.

trans-unit.source: Azure StorSimple can be configured to use either method.
trans-unit.target: Azure StorSimple can be configured to use either method.

trans-unit.source: The CHAP user name must contain fewer than 233 characters.
trans-unit.target: The CHAP user name must contain fewer than 233 characters.

trans-unit.source: The CHAP password must be between 12 and 16 characters.
trans-unit.target: The CHAP password must be between 12 and 16 characters.

trans-unit.source: Attempting to use a longer user name or password will result in an authentication failure on the Windows host.
trans-unit.target: Attempting to use a longer user name or password will result in an authentication failure on the Windows host.

trans-unit.source: You cannot use the same password for both the CHAP initiator and the CHAP target.
trans-unit.target: You cannot use the same password for both the CHAP initiator and the CHAP target.

trans-unit.source: After you set the password, it can be changed but it cannot be retrieved.
trans-unit.target: After you set the password, it can be changed but it cannot be retrieved.

trans-unit.source: If the password is changed, be sure to notify all remote access users so that they can successfully connect to the StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: If the password is changed, be sure to notify all remote access users so that they can successfully connect to the StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: For more information and to configure CHAP, go to [Configure CHAP for your StorSimple device](storsimple-configure-chap.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information and to configure CHAP, go to [Configure CHAP for your StorSimple device](storsimple-configure-chap.md).

trans-unit.target: StorSimple Snapshot Manager is a Microsoft Management Console (MMC) snap-in that uses volume groups and the Windows Volume Shadow Copy Service to generate application-consistent backups.

trans-unit.source: Password best practices
trans-unit.target: Password best practices

trans-unit.source: We recommend that you use the following guidelines to help ensure that Azure StorSimple passwords are strong and well-protected:
trans-unit.target: We recommend that you use the following guidelines to help ensure that Azure StorSimple passwords are strong and well-protected:

trans-unit.source: Change your passwords every three months.
trans-unit.target: Change your passwords every three months.

trans-unit.source: Use strong passwords.
trans-unit.target: Use strong passwords.

trans-unit.source: For more information, go to [Create stronger passwords and protect them](http://blogs.microsoft.com/cybertrust/2014/08/25/create-stronger-passwords-and-protect-them/).
trans-unit.target: For more information, go to [Create stronger passwords and protect them](http://blogs.microsoft.com/cybertrust/2014/08/25/create-stronger-passwords-and-protect-them/).

trans-unit.source: Always use different passwords for different access mechanisms; each of the passwords you specify should be unique.
trans-unit.target: Always use different passwords for different access mechanisms; each of the passwords you specify should be unique.

trans-unit.source: Do not share passwords with anyone who is not authorized to access the StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: Do not share passwords with anyone who is not authorized to access the StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: Do not speak about a password in front of others or hint at the format of a password.
trans-unit.target: Do not speak about a password in front of others or hint at the format of a password.

trans-unit.source: If you suspect that an account or password has been compromised, report the incident to your information security department.
trans-unit.target: If you suspect that an account or password has been compromised, report the incident to your information security department.

trans-unit.source: Treat all passwords as sensitive, confidential information.
trans-unit.target: Treat all passwords as sensitive, confidential information.

trans-unit.source: StorSimple data protection
trans-unit.target: StorSimple data protection

trans-unit.source: This section describes the Azure StorSimple security features that protect in-transit and stored data.
trans-unit.target: This section describes the Azure StorSimple security features that protect in-transit and stored data.

trans-unit.source: As described in other sections, passwords are used to authorize and authenticate users before they can gain access to your Microsoft Azure StorSimple solution.
trans-unit.target: As described in other sections, passwords are used to authorize and authenticate users before they can gain access to your Microsoft Azure StorSimple solution.

trans-unit.source: Another security consideration is protecting data from unauthorized users while it is being transferred between storage systems and while it is being stored.
trans-unit.target: Another security consideration is protecting data from unauthorized users while it is being transferred between storage systems and while it is being stored.

trans-unit.source: The following sections describe the data protection features provided with Azure StorSimple.
trans-unit.target: The following sections describe the data protection features provided with Azure StorSimple.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Deduplication provides additional protection for data stored on the StorSimple device and in Microsoft Azure storage.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Deduplication provides additional protection for data stored on the StorSimple device and in Microsoft Azure storage.

trans-unit.source: When data is deduplicated, the data objects are stored separately from the metadata used to map and access them: there is no available storage-level context to reconstruct the data based on volume structure, file system, or file name.
trans-unit.target: When data is deduplicated, the data objects are stored separately from the metadata used to map and access them: there is no available storage-level context to reconstruct the data based on volume structure, file system, or file name.

trans-unit.source: Protect data flowing through the service
trans-unit.target: Protect data flowing through the service

trans-unit.source: The primary purpose of the StorSimple Manager service is to manage and configure the StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: The primary purpose of the StorSimple Manager service is to manage and configure the StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: The StorSimple Manager service runs in Microsoft Azure.
trans-unit.target: The StorSimple Manager service runs in Microsoft Azure.

trans-unit.source: You use the Azure Management Portal to enter device configuration data, and then Microsoft Azure uses the StorSimple Manager service to send the data to the device.
trans-unit.target: You use the Azure Management Portal to enter device configuration data, and then Microsoft Azure uses the StorSimple Manager service to send the data to the device.

trans-unit.source: The StorSimple Manager service uses a system of asymmetric key pairs to help ensure that a compromise of the Azure service will not result in a compromise of stored information.
trans-unit.target: The StorSimple Manager service uses a system of asymmetric key pairs to help ensure that a compromise of the Azure service will not result in a compromise of stored information.

trans-unit.source: The asymmetric key system helps protect the data that flows through the service as follows:
trans-unit.target: The asymmetric key system helps protect the data that flows through the service as follows:

trans-unit.source: A data encryption certificate that uses an asymmetric public and private key pair is generated on the device and is used to protect the data.
trans-unit.target: A data encryption certificate that uses an asymmetric public and private key pair is generated on the device and is used to protect the data.

trans-unit.source: The keys are generated when the first device is registered.
trans-unit.target: The keys are generated when the first device is registered.

trans-unit.source: The data encryption certificate keys are exported into a Personal Information Exchange (.pfx) file that is protected by the service data encryption key, which is a strong 128-bit key that is randomly generated by the device during registration.
trans-unit.target: The data encryption certificate keys are exported into a Personal Information Exchange (.pfx) file that is protected by the service data encryption key, which is a strong 128-bit key that is randomly generated by the device during registration.

trans-unit.source: The public key of the certificate is securely made available to the StorSimple Manager service, and the private key remains with the device.
trans-unit.target: The public key of the certificate is securely made available to the StorSimple Manager service, and the private key remains with the device.

trans-unit.source: Data entering the service is encrypted using the public key and decrypted using the private key stored on the device, ensuring that the Azure service cannot decrypt the data flowing to the device.
trans-unit.target: Data entering the service is encrypted using the public key and decrypted using the private key stored on the device, ensuring that the Azure service cannot decrypt the data flowing to the device.

trans-unit.source: The service data encryption key is generated only on the first device registered with the service.
trans-unit.target: The service data encryption key is generated only on the first device registered with the service.

trans-unit.source: All subsequent devices that are registered with the service must use the same service data encryption key.
trans-unit.target: All subsequent devices that are registered with the service must use the same service data encryption key.

trans-unit.source: It is very important to make a copy of this key and save it in a secure location.
trans-unit.target: It is very important to make a copy of this key and save it in a secure location.

trans-unit.source: A copy of the service data encryption key should be stored in such a way that it can be accessed by an authorized person and can be easily communicated to the device administrator.
trans-unit.target: A copy of the service data encryption key should be stored in such a way that it can be accessed by an authorized person and can be easily communicated to the device administrator.

trans-unit.source: You can change the service data encryption key and the corresponding data encryption certificate by selecting the **Change service data encryption key** option on the service dashboard.
trans-unit.target: You can change the service data encryption key and the corresponding data encryption certificate by selecting the **Change service data encryption key** option on the service dashboard.

trans-unit.source: Changing the encryption keys requires that all devices be updated with the new key.
trans-unit.target: Changing the encryption keys requires that all devices be updated with the new key.

trans-unit.source: Therefore, we recommend that you change the key when all devices are online.
trans-unit.target: Therefore, we recommend that you change the key when all devices are online.

trans-unit.source: If devices are offline, their keys can be changed at a different time.
trans-unit.target: If devices are offline, their keys can be changed at a different time.

trans-unit.source: The devices with out-of-date keys will still be able to run backups, but they will not be able to restore data until the key is updated.
trans-unit.target: The devices with out-of-date keys will still be able to run backups, but they will not be able to restore data until the key is updated.

trans-unit.source: For more information, go to [Use the StorSimple Manager service dashboard](storsimple-service-dashboard.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, go to [Use the StorSimple Manager service dashboard](storsimple-service-dashboard.md).

trans-unit.source: To ensure that data security is not compromised, you must use a physical StorSimple device to change the service data encryption key.
trans-unit.target: To ensure that data security is not compromised, you must use a physical StorSimple device to change the service data encryption key.

trans-unit.source: If the service data encryption key is lost, a Microsoft support person can help you to retrieve it provided that you have at least one device in an online state.
trans-unit.target: If the service data encryption key is lost, a Microsoft support person can help you to retrieve it provided that you have at least one device in an online state.

trans-unit.source: We recommend that you change the service data encryption key after it is retrieved.
trans-unit.target: We recommend that you change the service data encryption key after it is retrieved.

trans-unit.source: For instructions, go to [Change the service data encryption key](storsimple-service-dashboard.md#change-the-service-data-encryption-key).
trans-unit.target: For instructions, go to [Change the service data encryption key](storsimple-service-dashboard.md#change-the-service-data-encryption-key).

trans-unit.source: The service data encryption key and the data encryption certificate do not expire.
trans-unit.target: The service data encryption key and the data encryption certificate do not expire.

trans-unit.source: However, we recommend that you change the service data encryption key on a regular schedule to help prevent key compromise.
trans-unit.target: However, we recommend that you change the service data encryption key on a regular schedule to help prevent key compromise.

trans-unit.source: Protect data at rest
trans-unit.target: Protect data at rest

trans-unit.source: The StorSimple device manages data by storing it in tiers locally and in the cloud, depending on frequency of use.
trans-unit.target: The StorSimple device manages data by storing it in tiers locally and in the cloud, depending on frequency of use.

trans-unit.source: All host machines that are connected to the device send data to the device, which then moves data to the cloud, as appropriate.
trans-unit.target: All host machines that are connected to the device send data to the device, which then moves data to the cloud, as appropriate.

trans-unit.source: Data is transferred from the device to the cloud over the iSCSI protocol.
trans-unit.target: Data is transferred from the device to the cloud over the iSCSI protocol.

trans-unit.source: Each device has one iSCSI target that surfaces all shared volumes on that device.
trans-unit.target: Each device has one iSCSI target that surfaces all shared volumes on that device.

trans-unit.source: All data is encrypted before it is sent to cloud storage.
trans-unit.target: All data is encrypted before it is sent to cloud storage.

trans-unit.source: To help ensure the security and integrity of data moved to the cloud, Azure StorSimple allows you to define cloud storage encryption keys as follows:
trans-unit.target: To help ensure the security and integrity of data moved to the cloud, Azure StorSimple allows you to define cloud storage encryption keys as follows:

trans-unit.source: You specify the cloud storage encryption key when you create a volume container.
trans-unit.target: You specify the cloud storage encryption key when you create a volume container.

trans-unit.source: The key cannot be modified or added later.
trans-unit.target: The key cannot be modified or added later.

trans-unit.source: All volumes in a volume container share the same encryption key.
trans-unit.target: All volumes in a volume container share the same encryption key.

trans-unit.source: If you want a different form of encryption for a specific volume, we recommend that you create a new volume container to host that volume.
trans-unit.target: If you want a different form of encryption for a specific volume, we recommend that you create a new volume container to host that volume.

trans-unit.source: When you enter the cloud storage encryption key in the StorSimple Manager service, the key is encrypted using the public portion of the service data encryption key and then sent to the device.
trans-unit.target: When you enter the cloud storage encryption key in the StorSimple Manager service, the key is encrypted using the public portion of the service data encryption key and then sent to the device.

trans-unit.source: The cloud storage encryption key is not stored anywhere in the service and is known only to the device.
trans-unit.target: The cloud storage encryption key is not stored anywhere in the service and is known only to the device.

trans-unit.source: Specifying a cloud storage encryption key is optional.
trans-unit.target: Specifying a cloud storage encryption key is optional.

trans-unit.source: You can send data that has been encrypted at the host to the device.
trans-unit.target: You can send data that has been encrypted at the host to the device.

trans-unit.source: Additional security best practices
trans-unit.target: Additional security best practices

trans-unit.source: To implement redundancy, use multipathing (MPIO) to avoid a single point of failure in the iSCSI SAN.
trans-unit.target: To implement redundancy, use multipathing (MPIO) to avoid a single point of failure in the iSCSI SAN.

trans-unit.source: For detailed instructions, see [Configure MPIO for your StorSimple device](storsimple-configure-mpio-windows-server.md).
trans-unit.target: For detailed instructions, see [Configure MPIO for your StorSimple device](storsimple-configure-mpio-windows-server.md).

trans-unit.source: Split traffic: isolate your iSCSI SAN from user traffic on a corporate LAN by deploying a totally separated network and using VLANs where physical isolation is not an option.
trans-unit.target: Split traffic: isolate your iSCSI SAN from user traffic on a corporate LAN by deploying a totally separated network and using VLANs where physical isolation is not an option.

trans-unit.source: A dedicated network for iSCSI storage will guarantee the safety and performance of your business-critical data.
trans-unit.target: A dedicated network for iSCSI storage will guarantee the safety and performance of your business-critical data.

trans-unit.source: Mixing storage and user traffic over a corporate LAN is not recommended and can increase latency and cause network failures.
trans-unit.target: Mixing storage and user traffic over a corporate LAN is not recommended and can increase latency and cause network failures.

trans-unit.source: For host-side network security, use network interfaces that support TCP/IP Offload Engine (TOE).
trans-unit.target: For host-side network security, use network interfaces that support TCP/IP Offload Engine (TOE).

trans-unit.source: TOE reduces CPU load by processing TCP on the network adapter.
trans-unit.target: TOE reduces CPU load by processing TCP on the network adapter.

trans-unit.source: Protect data via storage accounts
trans-unit.target: Protect data via storage accounts

trans-unit.source: Each Microsoft Azure subscription can create one or more storage accounts.
trans-unit.target: Each Microsoft Azure subscription can create one or more storage accounts.

trans-unit.source: (A storage account provides a unique namespace for working with data stored in the Azure cloud.) Access to a storage account is controlled by the subscription and access keys associated with that storage account.
trans-unit.target: (A storage account provides a unique namespace for working with data stored in the Azure cloud.) Access to a storage account is controlled by the subscription and access keys associated with that storage account.

trans-unit.source: When you create a storage account, Microsoft Azure generates two 512-bit storage access keys, one of which is used for authentication when the StorSimple device accesses the storage account.
trans-unit.target: When you create a storage account, Microsoft Azure generates two 512-bit storage access keys, one of which is used for authentication when the StorSimple device accesses the storage account.

trans-unit.source: Note that only one of these keys is in use.
trans-unit.target: Note that only one of these keys is in use.

trans-unit.source: The other key is held in reserve, allowing you to rotate the keys periodically.
trans-unit.target: The other key is held in reserve, allowing you to rotate the keys periodically.

trans-unit.source: To rotate keys, you make the secondary key active, and then delete the primary key.
trans-unit.target: To rotate keys, you make the secondary key active, and then delete the primary key.

trans-unit.source: You can then create a new key for use during the next rotation.
trans-unit.target: You can then create a new key for use during the next rotation.

trans-unit.source: (For security reasons, many datacenters require key rotation.)
trans-unit.target: (For security reasons, many datacenters require key rotation.)

trans-unit.source: We recommend that you follow these best practices for key rotation:
trans-unit.target: We recommend that you follow these best practices for key rotation:

trans-unit.source: You should rotate storage account keys regularly to help ensure that your storage account is not accessed by unauthorized users.
trans-unit.target: You should rotate storage account keys regularly to help ensure that your storage account is not accessed by unauthorized users.

trans-unit.source: Periodically, your Azure administrator should change or regenerate the primary or secondary key by using the Storage section of the Management Portal to directly access the storage account.
trans-unit.target: Periodically, your Azure administrator should change or regenerate the primary or secondary key by using the Storage section of the Management Portal to directly access the storage account.

trans-unit.source: **Q:** Is my data protected if the StorSimple Manager service is compromised?
trans-unit.target: **Q:** Is my data protected if the StorSimple Manager service is compromised?

trans-unit.source: **A:** Service configuration data is always encrypted with your public key when you view it in a web browser.
trans-unit.target: **A:** Service configuration data is always encrypted with your public key when you view it in a web browser.

trans-unit.source: Because the service doesn’t have access to the private key, the service will not be able to see any data.
trans-unit.target: Because the service doesn’t have access to the private key, the service will not be able to see any data.

trans-unit.source: If the StorSimple Manager service is compromised, there is no impact, as there are no keys stored in the StorSimple Manager service.
trans-unit.target: If the StorSimple Manager service is compromised, there is no impact, as there are no keys stored in the StorSimple Manager service.

trans-unit.source: **Q:** If someone gains access to the data encryption certificate, will my data be compromised?
trans-unit.target: **Q:** If someone gains access to the data encryption certificate, will my data be compromised?

trans-unit.source: **A:** Microsoft Azure stores the customer’s data encryption key (.pfx file) in an encrypted format.
trans-unit.target: **A:** Microsoft Azure stores the customer’s data encryption key (.pfx file) in an encrypted format.

trans-unit.source: Because the .pfx file is encrypted and the StorSimple service doesn’t have the service data encryption key to decrypt the .pfx file, simply getting access to the .pfx file will not expose any secrets.
trans-unit.target: Because the .pfx file is encrypted and the StorSimple service doesn’t have the service data encryption key to decrypt the .pfx file, simply getting access to the .pfx file will not expose any secrets.

trans-unit.source: **Q:** What happens if a governmental entity asks Microsoft for my data?
trans-unit.target: **Q:** What happens if a governmental entity asks Microsoft for my data?

trans-unit.source: **A:** Because all of the data is encrypted on the service and the private key is kept with the device, the governmental entity must ask the customer for the data.
trans-unit.target: **A:** Because all of the data is encrypted on the service and the private key is kept with the device, the governmental entity must ask the customer for the data.
